New Records: Sri Lanka sealed the three-match ODI series with a game in hand and have now won ten straight ODI matches in Sri Lanka, a record they certainly won’t be proud of.
Key Match Events: Sherfane Rutherford and Gudakesh Motie did exceptionally well to take West Indies to 189 runs, it was a below-par total.
The stand between Nishan Madushka and Sadeera Samarawickrama was crucial for Sri Lanka.
Charith Asalanka then took charge and together with Janith Liyanage made sure that there were no hiccups.
Kamindu Mendis tucked the ball to the right of sweeper covers for a couple of runs and Sri Lanka won the match with 5 wickets.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts did not provide any pre-game insights in this article.
Post-Match Reflections: Charith Asalanka, the Sri Lankan skipper, said that the series win is huge and the guys deserved it.
Shai Hope, the captain of West Indies, said that he doesn’t want to focus on things beyond their control like the toss and it was just a disappointing performance today.
Maheesh Theekshana said that he got to play because of the rain and considers himself lucky as he was in the late and got the call pretty late from the coach.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in rain-hit conditions, which affected the gameplay.
West Indies lost the game in the very first hour or so of play where they lost 8 wickets for 58 runs in about 15 overs.
Others: The final ODI will be played on Saturday, October 26 in Pallekele again and will begin at 9 am GMT with West Indies looking to end the tour on a high and the hosts looking for a clean sweep.
